attributes.action: Ban door-to-door fundraising by large charities (so called 'doorstep chuggers')
attributes.background: This method of fundraising can be intrusive and where high pressure tactics are used by the fundraisers (who may in cases be remunerated based on the level of donation commitments they secure), can potentially put elderly or vulnerable persons in a position where they are taken advantage of.
attributes.additional_details: Our view is that attempts to regulate this form of fundraising activity seem ineffective and as such our petition is for an outright ban to make the position clearer on what is and is not allowed.

attributes.action: Make it Illegal to ignore the "No Junk Mail" and "No Callers" Door signs
attributes.background: The "Junk Mail" and "No Callers"  signs are placed on doors by residents in an attempt to stop the need to deal with this menace. But because there is no legal requirement, the wishes of these residents are ignored, and the rights of the residents to not be harassed in their own home are violated.
attributes.additional_details: This type of law is already in place in countries like Australia, and USA

attributes.action: An alternative intergrated solution to Heathrow airport expansion
attributes.background:
Heathrow expansion can only exasperate West London’s housing and congestion problems.
I believe London’s future success and those of rest of UK will best be served by deliberately planning to reduce pressures on London's limited resources. 
Hence this proposal as a two prong solution.
attributes.additional_details:
1)Build a *new* international airport(linked to HS2), of similar size to Heathrow, around Birmingham. 
2)Divert half of all Heathrow's contracts to the new airport. Reducing pressures on London's resources. 
Some of the benefits are
•Sharing traffic between West/North of London. 
•More passenger capacity than a single runway extension.
•Help tourism/service industry in the north of UK. 
•In Emergencies, as both airports are of similar size, they can better cope with diversion of air traffic.

attributes.action: Prevent the exclusion of primary school children due to their haircuts.
attributes.background: A Birmingham primary school pupil was suspended from his school because his haircut 'wasn't suitable for their school policy' despite looking very smart. If a child has a smart, socially acceptable haircut, they should be allowed to wear it without harassment from their school.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-birmingham-36269041

attributes.action: Create a NHS and Care Commission to review and manage all health care in the UK.
attributes.background: The 21st C has brought new challenges to the health and care provision which underpins the well being of all in the UK. It is timely to review the NHS to ensure that it meets modern needs but retains the ethos of equality of services and  provision, free at point of delivery.

attributes.action: Change the tax system so student loan repayments are taken before income tax.
attributes.background: Most students can not use their income tax allowance whilst studying at university and rely on borrowing money from the students loan company to cover living expenses. Therefore, repayments of this student debt should be exempt from income tax.
attributes.additional_details:
These changes would bring the following benefits:

1. Earlier repayment and reduced pressure of student debt
2. A fairer systems for those starting out in life
3. Additional encouragement for further education

attributes.action: Offer a free workshop on healthy eating on a budget to all UK residents
attributes.background: Myth; 'eating healthily is more expensive than buying junk food'. Pre-packed food or pre-prepared food can be much more expensive and full of sugars, fats and preservatives than making from scratch. More education is needed to make healthy shopping choices, ultimately improving the nation's health.
attributes.additional_details:
If people are educated on how to read the supermarket price labels of fruit and veg for instance, quite often it is cheaper to buy loose vegetables than it is to buy pre-packed. Educate on how simple healthy meals can be made with very few cheap ingredients. e.g.

Vegetarian tomato pasta dish; home-made total price for a family of 4; £0.89.

If wanting to add meat (Beef mince as an addition) ; Total price £2.89 for 4 servings.

Alternative pre-packed pre-made product, 4 servings; £6.60.

attributes.action: Legalise muskets, cannons and swords for self defence
attributes.background: Similar to the second amendment in the US, muskets, swords and cannons can be possessed if a relevant licence is held (level 1 for a sword, level 2 for a musket and 3 for a cannon)the weapons cannot be concealed.Also create a body to monitor gun owners and distribute licences.

attributes.action: All new trees planted on Government owned land should be fruit trees
attributes.background: All new trees on Government owned land should be fruit trees and the produce of those trees should be made freely available to members of the public

attributes.action: Call on the government to publicly confirm support for strong encryption.
attributes.background: The government should not erode the security of our devices or applications, pressure companies to keep and allow government access to our data, mandate implementation of vulnerabilities or backdoors into products or have disproportionate access to the keys to  our private data.
attributes.additional_details:
The public demands privacy, security, and integrity for their communications and devices. As a public, we should be confident that the services we use haven’t been weakened or compromised by government mandate or pressure. No legislation or private agreement with the government should undermine our rights.

Weakening encryption weakens the entire Internet. Endorse strong encryption and encourage other world governments to do the same.

attributes.action: Stop the reassessment and resultant refusal of blue badges to disabled people
attributes.background:
A GOVERNMENT SHOULD BE JUDGED UPON HOW IT TREATS ITS LEAST FORTUNATE CITIZENS 
We are in a period of time where disabled people all across the country are being re-assessed for their needs, including their access to a blue badge. Please put a stop to the 1000s of disabled people losing them unjust.
attributes.additional_details: Not only is this reassessment traumatic enough for disabled people, with the potential consequence of losing their ability to confidently leave the house, assessors are in a position where they have to justify their performance through means of denying access to a certain number of people, thus looking to deny future access to a blue badge wherever they see fit. Recently, a family member who cannot walk 50 feet was told her blue badge is being revoked, due to 'evidence' that they can walk fine.

attributes.action: Bring back Corporal Punishment for heinous crimes, e.g. Murder & Rape
attributes.background: Prison terms are too lenient in the UK and I think only way to deter people committing heinous crimes is to bring back Corporal Punishment

attributes.action: Let children go on holiday when they like & keep schools open 253 days a year.
attributes.background: Many families are priced out of holidays because traditional school holidays cause peaks in demand. If schools are open all year round families can synchronise their holiday to suit their work commitments. Schools can then arrange catch up lessons for children who have been on holiday.
attributes.additional_details:
Long summer holidays disrupt children`s education and inhibit learning.

The economy of the country would benefit as families would not have to rely on expensive holiday child care.

Industry would benefit from parents not having to take time off work due to child care commitments.

Children will receive more education creating a better educated society.

Parents will avoid being fined for taking children out of school.

More full time jobs would be created rather than seasonal employment.

attributes.action: Allow voters to choose to rerun an election if a plurality wish it.
attributes.background: It's clear from the turnout at elections that voters are disenchanted with politics.  Many claim they dislike all candidates. All ballot papers should have an option for None of the above (NOTA). If NOTA gets more votes than any candidate, that area's election should be rerun with new candidates.
attributes.additional_details: Voter turnout in the UK has been on a long-term downward trend.  Before 2000, national elections typically attracted over 70% turnout (see http://www.ukpolitical.info/Turnout45.htm) and 80% in the early 1950s.  Since 2000, general election turnout has been below 70%.  In addition, the ability to reject a slate of candidates would address or ease many of the issues identified in the Parliamentary report here: http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201415/cmselect/cmpolcon/232/23205.htm

attributes.action: Stop landlords from discriminating against young people
attributes.background: Landlords legally have the right to disallow young people usually 18-24 from renting their properties. Most use the stereotypical excuse of "they just want to party" or "they wreck the place" I myself have become homeless due to this and discrimination against any characteristic should be banned.

attributes.action: Scrap the proposed Sugar Tax levy
attributes.background: This newly proposed Sugar Tax levy on the drinks giants is nothing more than, yet another in-direct taxation on the lower paid working class public.
attributes.additional_details:
If the government wishes to raise additional funds for the NHS, due to obese people putting additional pressure on the service, then the government should also place additional taxation on all the fitness fanatics, of whom cost the NHS millions each year in joint replacements, muscle and ligament rebuilds.

Other countries have tried to implement the same levy and have proved that it had little to no effect on the rates of obesity. 

Let’s get this crazy tax levy scrapped before it’s started.

attributes.action: Not using signals correctly when driving should be a criminal offence
attributes.background: Introduce a fine for incorrect use of indicators at junctions and roundabouts.
attributes.additional_details: Incorrect use of signals cause unnecessary hold ups and leads to accidents

attributes.action: Keep present allowances for disabled and assisted accomodation tenants.
attributes.background: The present efforts by the government to attack the poorest and most vulnerable in our society must stop.I work with both the disabled and the homeless who do not have a voice. Help me and sign this petition to be their voice.
attributes.additional_details: Rental allowances from benefit are capped and often fall short of the required amount- which then has to be topped up from benefits- often leaving individuals with less than £60 a week for all their needs (food, toiletries, transport, household goods etc) This is inhuman treatment of the most vulnerable in our society who need our help and support.The allowances should be kept and increased yearly in line with the cost of living index.

attributes.action: DWP: decision to extend the waiting time for Mortgage payment to 39 weeks!
attributes.background:
If you get laid off / paid off / made redundant and have a mortgage – you have to wait 39 Weeks before the DWP will make any payment to your lender? 
This is a disgrace – It used to be 13 Weeks wait before April of this year, which was bad enough, but now 9 Months – how are people meant to survive?
attributes.additional_details:
What are the government thinking abouts? 
Do they want to make people homeless? They would then be responsible for housing them.
There is a severe lack of social housing – and this will just add to the crisis. Social housing will cost 3-4 times the amount of the mortgage!

SMI: Support for Mortgage Interest 
https://www.gov.uk/support-for-mortgage-interest/what-youll-get

attributes.action: Make it illegal to park on or in front of a dropped kerb and private driveways.
attributes.background: Current high way code rules recommend that people do not block private driveways. As this is not an illegal action, people suffer the consequences of irresponsible parking by others. The move to make this action illegal and therefore give the police power to discourage problems.

attributes.action: Bring in a law to stop any more buildings over 30 floors being built in London.
attributes.background: London isn't Manhattan. Our original environment is dwarfed by mega-towers that no-one lives in. Let's ask the Government to bring in planning law to prevent any more towers over 30 floors being built in Central London. Those extra floors aren't solving any housing crisis - just overseas investors
attributes.additional_details:
Guardian article on 50 story St George's Wharf tower - the blight of Vauxhall riverside: 
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/24/revealed-foreign-buyers-own-two-thirds-of-tower-st-george-wharf-london
This Ipsos mori survey for Skyline Campaign suggests that lots of people agree with me: 
http://workplaceinsight.net/majority-of-londoners-support-greater-restrictions-on-new-tall-buildings/

attributes.action: Reform the use and duration of Pre-Charge Bail
attributes.background: The current use of Pre-Charge Bail is unacceptable. Firstly, restrictions are imposed upon individuals who have not been charged with a crime, and imposed without evidence. Secondly, there is no maximum duration for this imposition, therefore suspects can be held in legal limbo for years.
attributes.additional_details:
What is Pre-Charge Bail?
Pre-charge bail is a legal loophole in which an individual who has been arrested, but not charged, can be placed on bail while police gather evidence. 

Prime Minister (then Home Secretary) Theresa May has said:
"I have been clear that it is simply not acceptable for individuals to spend months and in some cases years on pre-charge bail, with no system of review, only for charges never to be brought against them."

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory driving licence re-testing for old age pensioners
attributes.background:
It has been shown numerous times that old age causes lowered reflexes and reaction times. This has been reflected in the high level of accidents and poor driving from pensioners.

To maintain the standards of driving on UK roads, I propose mandatory re-testing above a certain age (perhaps ~70).
attributes.additional_details:
Here's is the most recent example of many: 

"Eight car pile-up after elderly driver goes wrong way down motorway"

http://metro.co.uk/2016/08/31/eight-car-pile-up-after-elderly-driver-goes-wrong-way-down-motorway-6101485/#ixzz4IzPn56B6

Studies suggest that older drivers are no more dangerous than young drivers, but it is scientifically certain that old age results in degradation of the senses. As such, it stands to reason that there is a point when driving is no longer a safe endeavour.

attributes.action: Take action to break the siege in Aleppo and enforce a no bombing zone.
attributes.background: Send a message to the people of Aleppo to say that we are listening and we are taking action. We will apply pressure on our government to do more.
attributes.additional_details:
Dr. Hatem, Director of the Aleppo Children’s Hospital run by the Independent Doctor’s Association (IDA): 
"We need the international community. And that means pressure from you. Tell your government, tell the UN, tell every international institution that the world can still break the siege and stop the bombs. Please, save us. Save Aleppo."

attributes.action: Give prisoners the right to vote
attributes.background: The European Court of Human Rights has told the UK it is violating a human right by not allowing prisoners to vote.The Government is choosing to ignore this, however this is preventing a true democracy in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: https://fullfact.org/law/votes-prisoners-politics-versus-human-rights-law/

attributes.action: Return the railways to full state control and ownership
attributes.background:
High prices, rotten service on our trains..Let get our railways back to full state ownership so profits benefit train users not shareholders..
Each private contract ends so it can be taken over by the state. No big buyouts needed..

attributes.action: Increase the restriction speed for 50cc mopeds to 60mph
attributes.background: I use 60mph roads on a regular basis. I have found that other road users grow impatient of trailing behind me at 30mph and many find that it's a good idea to pass at dangerous points of which could easily result in a threat on my life as some cars overtake and narrowly avoid a head on crash
attributes.additional_details: I have been riding my 50cc motorbike for a few months now and I have to use 60mph/40mph roads on a regular basis on my way to school. I have found that other road users in larger vehicles grow impatient of trailing behind me at 30mph and many find that it's a good idea to pass on corners and/or dangerously close to me. There have also been some that risk a head on crash in an attempt to pass. A faster speed in my eyes would eliminate the threat that other road users oppose to slower mopeds.

attributes.action: Close legal loophole allowing NHS Price cap rules to be bypassed. Criminalise it
attributes.background: Several unscrupulous companies have made millions by legally bypassing the NHS price cap rules, by dropping the brand names of medicines and giving them their generic name.  This has caused astronomical price hikes, and patients are being refused their medicines because the NHS cannot afford them.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3623324/Millionaire-firms-forcing-price-common-NHS-drugs-262MILLION-year-exploiting-branding-loophole.html

attributes.action: Legalise the age of buying and smoking e-juice to 14 with parental consent
attributes.background: Vaping and smoking e-juices do not harm kids! I'm 14 years old and I stopped smoking and moved onto e-juice. This is much less harmful then cigarettes and maybe more kids might stop smoking if the legal age was dropped.

attributes.action: Reduce APD to bring it in line with other European countries.
attributes.background: For too long the UK has paid extortionate taxes on air travel - far higher than other countries. Reduce APD so that people can afford their well earned holidays.

attributes.action: Declare a national day of mourning when David Attenborough dies.
attributes.background: All non-essential services stop (most offices, shops etc) in order for all to stay home and watch his programmes.

attributes.action: Allow alternative advanced chemotherapy treatment in the UK
attributes.background: We have a very close friend who is terminally ill with cancer. Our dear friend Brigitta, who is a mother of 2 children, Marco and Denym and loving wife to Massi has fought this dreadful disease for 13 years and endured various forms of treatment. She is now in need of advanced specialist treatment
attributes.additional_details:
To enable Brigitta to live her life and feel slightly more normal again, we are having to raise £30,000 to send her overseas for specialist medical treatment which could really make a difference to her health and current situation. 
If this was to be available in the UK to Brigitta, then her family would not have the concerns they do about funds and could have this advanced treatment without having to rely so much on other peoples help. 
We are currently organising events and fundraising pages to help Brigitta through her journey, and hope we reach this goal to get her this treatment that she deserves.
Please help and support this worthy cause, and get this treatment into the UK!

attributes.action: Make inheritance tax applicable to all estates without exception.
attributes.background: It appears very rich people can avoid paying inheritance tax by using tax avoidance measures such as trusts. It would be fair if tax laws were simple and applied to everyone. If it is the law that inheritance tax is paid on estates above a certain value it must apply to everyone without exception.

attributes.action: make naloxone available to all opiate / opioid users in the uk.
attributes.background: I myself have almost lost my life to opiate overdoses and I have lost friends to opiate overdoses. lets do our best to stop this. This drug has absolutely no effect on people without opiates / opioids in their system.
attributes.additional_details: Naloxone is a medication used to counter the effects of opioid overdose Specifically, naloxone is used in opioid overdoses to counteract life-threatening depression of the central nervous system and respiratory system, allowing an overdose victim to breathe normally. Naloxone only works if a person has opioids in their system; the medication has no effect if opioids are absent. Naloxone has no potential for abuse.  It is a temporary drug that wears off in 20-90 minutes. (harmreduction.org)

attributes.action: Establish a National Burkini Day.
attributes.background: Swimming at beaches, in public or private pools is everyone's right.  Those who chose to do so in a Burkini should be encouraged to participate in such recreation.  Establishment of National Burkini Day would be in the best traditions of our great country.  Please support this petition.

attributes.action: We demand reform to the honours system to re-establish public trust
attributes.background: Honours nominations by the Prime Minister which are viewed as rewarding (i) financial donations to his/her party or (ii) private service to the Prime Minister and his/her close associates are corrosive of public trust in the political system.
attributes.additional_details: We demand reform of the honours system so that it reflects genuine public service and outstanding achievement as it is meant to do. The current honours committee structure is clearly not robust enough to achieve this. We demand democratic accountability of honours recommendations by the Prime Minister to be strengthened such that they can be scrutinised and/or blocked by Members of Parliament.

attributes.action: Register Endometriosis As a Disability
attributes.background: Hello My name is Selina-Louise and I Suffer With a Condition Called Endometriosis its a life changing condition which is extremely painful , it's where the lining of the uterus grows outside and can spread to the bowls and even lungs there is no cure.
attributes.additional_details: It should be a known condition and defiantly should be registered as a disability it's incredibly painful and has left some women infertile

attributes.action: Make .22 Rimfire Pistols legal for Sporting purposes on FAC Certificates
attributes.background: In 1997 The UK Labour party Prime minister Tony Blair brought in The Firearm Ammendment Act of 1997 Number 2 which banned all .22 rimfire pistols for section 1 holders. I feel like the ban was unessecary and pointless and I feel that we have been treated as gulity people but we are not.
attributes.additional_details: Whoever holds a section 1 licence should have any gun they wish. Because what doesn't make sense is that if 22 rimfire semi auto rifles are legal then why can't we own a 22 rimfire pistol. If we somehow stand up against anti gun people and prove to them of how guns are not evil people that are bad are evil. If you even don't have a licence but support this sport you can push us to victory and freedom for this sport and live in a country with zero threat.

attributes.action: Change the upgrading process for motorcycle licenses.
attributes.background:
On 19th January 2013 the motorcycle licence restrictions changed for new motorcycle riders. 

This meant that in order to upgrade from an A2 motorcycle license to an A motorcycle license requires the rider to pass the exact same test that they passed two years prior on an arbitrarily smaller bike.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst the tiered licensing system has its merits, and rightfully deserves to stay, a rethink on the upgrading process for riders must be considered.

If the automatic upgrade that was in place before the 2013 update is not satisfactory, perhaps some type of competency test on a larger motorcycle could be implemented, to ensure the rider's skills are still satisfactory - an advanced version of the CBT for riders with existing qualifications who wish to advance through their licenses.

attributes.action: Make discrimination of tattoos/piercings in the workplace a criminal offence
attributes.background: People shouldn't be discriminated against for their tattoos or piercings because it doesn't affect your quality/quantity of work. It's the same as discriminating against someone for their hair/eye/skin colour.
attributes.additional_details: Many people are discriminated against for their tattoos/piercings and a lot of people are rejected jobs because of them. body art doesn't affect the way someone works or how much someone works. so why are tattoos and piercings such a problem in the workplace?

attributes.action: Debit card charges to be set at a fair level and charges itemised on  reciept .
attributes.background:
Shop can currently charge what ever they like if a card is used .
goverment should set a max fee and ensure the fee charged is itemised on reciept

attributes.action: Harsher punishments for people who discriminate.
attributes.background: Hate crime is on the rise. There was 4,345 cases of homophobic hate crime in 2011/12 and there was 5,597 cases in 2014/15. These criminals only get a fine or a short prison sentence for their crimes, this has to be changed.
attributes.additional_details: I know myself what it is like to be discriminated and disrespected, its an awful feeling and makes you question yourself and your existence.

attributes.action: Government to take full admittance on the 'tainted blood scandal' & an apology.
attributes.background: The "Tainted Blood Scandal" is the event of nearly 5,000 people being infected with the Hepatitis C and 1,200 being infected with HIV, often during treatment for Haemophilia or Blood Transfusion by the NHS in the 1970s and 1980s and the subsequent government reaction.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite numerous calls from campaigners, victims and MP's over the years, successive governments in Westminster have refused to hold a Public Inquiry into the matter.

To date no government, health or pharmaceutical entity in the UK has admitted liability for the scandal and no compensation has been paid to those infected or affected. Compensation has been paid in Ireland.

attributes.action: Make St George's day a public holiday.
attributes.background: Theresa May's first act as Prime Minister should be to make St George's day a public holiday thereby uniting all of England through patriotism as well as helping to boost the British Economy.

attributes.action: Install Average Speed Cameras the entire length of the A34 in Oxfordshire
attributes.background:
As reported on national news the A34 has had over 50 deaths in the last 5 years, a significant factor being excessive speed.
There have been calls to reduce the speed limit to 50mph, but regardless of this - there must be robust enforcement, which only a full Average Speed Camera system can achieve
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-oxfordshire-36750468

attributes.action: Completely Scrap Stamp Duty, we pay enough taxes!
attributes.background: Stamp Duty should be scraped, we pay enough already in taxes and scraping Stamp Duty will help people to afford to buy a property

attributes.action: Negotiate personal EU membership for certain categories of UK citizen.
attributes.background: Citizens with either: 1. A spouse with EU citizenship; or 2. Pension rights in an EU member state; have had their European homeland taken from them and their family lives crippled. Personal EU membership confirmed by an official passport endorsement would help to mitigate that injustice.
attributes.additional_details:
Under Personal Membership of the EU, eligible individuals would benefit from Non-discrimination and Citizenship of the Union as described in Part Two of the Consolidated Treaties and Charter of Fundamental Rights, Articles 18–25.
http://europa.eu/pol/pdf/consolidated-treaties_en.pdf#page=57

attributes.action: Make it Illegal to prescribe paracetamol
attributes.background: In 2015 over 22 million prescriptions for paracetamol were written at a cost to tax payers of over £80 million pounds – an average cost of £3.67 per prescription.....paracetamol can be purchased for 19p!!!!!

attributes.action: Pass legislation to restrict betting on referenda and general elections.
attributes.background: Shortly before the EU Referendum, bookmakers' odds for Remain were 1/4, while those for Leave were 5/1. Such odds have the potential to influence voting, irrespective of the political issues at stake. It is reported that 69 per cent of individual bets were placed on Leave.
attributes.additional_details:
Reference: Financial Times dated 26 June 2016
"Brexit wagers set new record for non-sports bets" by Paul McClean.

attributes.action: A public enquiry to review why people voted as they did in the EU referendum.
attributes.background:
It too easy for politicians just to say referendum complete, democracy has been served. Public opinion must be present throughout the whole process, to ensure we receive a democratic outcome. 

This is a massive decision in the country's history we should find out the facts before we progress.
attributes.additional_details:
UK decision makers must be armed with infomation which details the reasons why the UK electorate voted as they did. Enabling these decision makers to formulate the next steps in a way which is in line with public opinion.

Lies have been told on both sides.

People seem to have been unaware of possible economic consequences.

Decisions have been revaluated.

Votes may have been cast as a protest against the UK government.
